notes: #description
On October 25, 2019, Military Forces reportedly killed one civilian in Malende.
On October 25, 2019, the Military Forces reportedly killed two Ambazonian Separatists in Sop, Jakiri district. Sop location unfound [coded at geoprecision 2].
On October 25, 2019, military forces reportedly killed one civilian in Mbalangi.

On October 25, 2019, the military forces reportedly attacked one person in Wainkar [unfound location within Jakiri district, coded: Jakiri at geoprecision 2].It was not specified if the the person attacked was actually killed.
On October 24, 2019, unidentified armed men attacked the village of Ganai [unfound location within Mora, coded: Mora at geoprecision 2]. They took food and goods. No fatalities were reported.
On October 24, 2019, Boko Haram killed one Cameroonian soldier in an ambush on the road from Ridoua to Goshi [coded: Ridoua at geoprecision 2].
On October 24, 2019, the Military Forces arrested 5 members of Boko Haram in Grea IDP camp near Kolofata [unfound location].

On October 22, 2019, military forces raided the village of Ntanhah in the Nord-Ouest [unfound location, coded: Bamenda, capital city of the Nord-Ouest region at geoprecision 2]. They reportedly killed one civilian.

Between October 20-22, 2019 [coded: October 21, 2019] Military Forces raided Ambazonian Separatists' camps in Lebialem district [location coded: Menji, capital city of Lebialem district], in an attempt to capture Lekeahka Oliver who proclaimed himself king of Lebialem. 6 Ambazonian Separatists were killed.
On October 21, 2019, former students of Government High School Ebone attacked the school principal and his daughter in Nkongsamba. The principal was reportedly wounded with a machete.
On October 20, 2019, Ambazonian Separatists killed and beheaded one police officer in Bamenda, while he was off duty.
On October 18, 2019, suspected Ambazonian Separatists killed a leader of a Vigilante Group in Bamenda (another source: Cameroon News Agency reported 2 killed)
On October 18, 2019, Boko Haram killed one person and abducted 3 others in an attack on Goledje in Mayo Moskota subdivision [unfound location, coded: Mayo Moskota, capital of the subdivision].
On October 17, 2019, a group of traders protested in Yagoua, accusing the city's attorney of corruption. [size=no report]
On October 17, 2019, a repentant fighter of the Ambazonian Separtists was killed in Wum, just a day after he officially dropped his arms. There is no clue about his murderers.
On October 17, 2019, Chadian militaries reportedly killed 2 people in Chewe [unfound location near Blangoua, coded: Blangoua]

On October 16, 2019, Ambazonian Separatists reportedly attacked workers of the Cameroon Development Corporation in Tiko, injuring 5 of them and abducting 4. Ambazonian leaders denied having conducted that attack.
On October 15, 2019, Boko Karam killed one person in Kassa, near Talkomari [unfound location, coded: Talkomari].
On October 15, 2019, Boko Haram killed one person in Kerawa.
On October 15, 2019, Boko Haram attaked Nguetchewe, injuring 3 young boys and taking away some cattle.

On an unspecified date [coded in the middle of the month: October 15, 2019 at time precision 3], an Ambazonian separatist leader, Lekeahka Oliver, proclaimed himself king of Lebialem [location coded: Menji, capital city of Lebialem district] after chasing out ruling traditional leaders.
On October 14, 2019, Boko Haram attacked the village of Goshi [unfound location, coded: Mokolo, the capital of the district of Mayo-Tsanaga], killing one person and taking away a herd of cattle.
On October 14, 2019, Boko Haram attacked to shops in Kolofata. Blood was reportedly found on the place but no dead body.
On October 13, 2019, Boko Haram killed one person in Badahal Gossi [unfound location, coded: Tourou, center of the administrative subdivision of the location]
On October 13, 2019, Boko Haram killed one person in Charif-Moussari.
On October 12, 2019, Boko Haram abducted a member of a Vigilante Group in Kolofata.
On October 10, 2019, Boko Haram attacked Galda [unfound location, coded: Mora as the location is known to be in Mora], killing two people and injuring three others.

On October 9, 2019, a group of angry youths looted several shops and warehouses belonging to people of Noun origin in Sangmelima, as they claimed that a commercial motorbike driver was killed by a person from Noun. During the protests, the rioters also tried to broke into the Sengmelina gendarmerie post but they were repelled. Some of the people in Sengmelina were reported to have defended themselves against the rioters that cause further violence but details remained unknown.
On October 8, 2019, Ambazonian Separatists abducted 3 people in Bamenda.
On October 7, 2019, Boko Haram attacked the village of Kerawa, killing one woman and injuring two people. Another sources (Sembe TV, Xinhua) reports 2 killed.
On October 6, 2019, Boko Haram attacked Kolofata, looting 5 shops. No fatality reported.
On October 5, 2019, Military Forces attacked the village of Sang, in the neighborhood of Bali-Nyonga [unfound location, coded: Bali Nyonga]. No fatality reported.
On October 5, 2019, Military Forces attacked the village of Bali-Nyonga, reportedly killing 9 people.

actor2: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
notes: On October 5, 2019, Maurice Kamto the leader of the MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon was released alonside with 100 militants of his party who were detained for taking part in demonstrations against the re-election of Paul Biya in november 2018.
On October 4, 2019, Boko Haram abducted 20 people in Kerawa. 19 of them were released after an intervention by the Military Forces.

On October 4, 2019, Military Forces of Cameroon were reported to have conducted an attack on Boko Haram in Kerawa. Boko Haram had kidnapped 20 people previously in the same village. Casuality number not known from the military intervention.
On October 4, 2019, Boko Haram abducted 20 people in Kerawa. 19 of them were later released during an intervention by the Military Forces (military intervention coded seperately).

On October 3, 2019, the President of Cameroon ordered the release of 333 people detained in the context of the conflict in the English-speaking regions. This is an outcome of the Major national dialogue that started in Yaounde on September 30.
On October 3, 2019, Boko Haram and beheaded one villager in Blabline.
On October 3, 2019, Boko Haram attacked the village of Mozogo, injuring some villagers.
On October 3, 2019, Boko Haram attacked the village of Talkomari, killing one person and taking away foods and dressings.
On September 30, 2019, Ambazonian Separatists killed one member of the Military Forces Gendarmerie in attack in Bamenjin [unfound location, coded: Bamenda]

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Prison Guards
notes: On September 30, 2019, suspected Ambazonian Separatists killed and beheaded one Prison Guard while off duty in Bamenda.
On September 30, 2019, Boko Haram looted one shop and took away food in Kolofata.
On September 30, 2019, Boko Haram attacked the village of Dougdje 3 kilometers from Kerawa [unfound location, coded: Kerawa], abducting 2 villagers.
On September 29, 2019, Military Forces killed one commander of Ambazonian Separatists in Owe [Unfound location, coded: Muyuka]. Other source (Xinhua) reports 4 other Ambazonian Separatists killed.
On September 29, 2019, Military Forces attacked the village of Akwaya. No fatality was reported.
On September 29, 2019, Military Forces raided the village of Bafia in Muyuka, killing one person and injuring 5 others.
On September 29, 2019, Military Forces raided the village of Munyenge. No fatality was reported. An earlier attack in the week caused fatalities.
On September 29, 2019, Boko Haram attacked the village of Ganse and took away a motorbike. No fatality was reported.
On September 28, 2019, Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah attacked the village of Tolkomari, killing one civilian and wounding 3 others.
On September 28, 2019, Military Forces attacked the village of Ediki, reportedly killing 2 people.
On September 28, 2019, Boko Haram attacked the village of Satomi, near Talkomari [unfound location, coded: Talkomari]. One person was killed and two others injured.
On September 27, 2019, the Military Forces of Cameroon repelled an attack of Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah in Sandawadjiri. No fatality was reported.

On an unspectified date within the week of September 23-30 [coded: September 26], Military Forces raided the village of Munyenge, killing 5 people and injuring 9 others. A second attack in the village happened on the 29th.

On September 25, 2019, Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah attacked the locality of Yegoua [unfound location 5 km from Kolofata, coded Kolofata]. Casualities not known. They carried away small ruminants and materials.
On September 25, 2019, Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah attacked the the Military Forces of Cameroon in a mountainous area near Kerawa.
On September 24, 2019, Military Forces of Cameroon reportedly attacked a palace in Bafut, killing one person.
On September 23, 2019, an Unidentified Armed Group looted a shop in Kolofata. Locals speculate that the looters were Boko Haram, but this has not been confirmed.
On September 23, 2019, Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah attacked a house in Niguidiwa [unfound location, coded: Mayo-Sava], killing one and stealing cattle.
On September 23, 2019, Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) interverned after Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah attacked a house in Niguidiwa [unfound location, coded: Mayo-Sava].
On September 23, 2019, an Unidentified Armed Group attacked the village of Bia, wounding one villager and stealing goods.

On September 21, 2019, Boko Haram killed 1 Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) soldier and injured 4 others alongside with 4 members of a local militia in an attack on Guistsenad [unfound location, coded: Tourou].
On September 20, 2019, Boko Haram attacked the locality of Pivou [unfound exact location, coded: Kolofata], killing 1 civilian and injuring 2 others.
On September 20, 2019, Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) repelled an attack by Ambazonian Separatists on a hotel of Bamenda, where government officials were staying.

On September 19, 2019, Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) killed 5 militants of Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad in an ambush near Kidi river, 10 kilometers from Tolkomari [unfound location, coded: Kolofata]
On September 19, 2019, militants of Boko Haram looted several homes and stole goods in Ganse.

On September 19, 2019, Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) opened fire on civilians after they mistook them for militants of Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction) in Woulgo, Extreme-Nord. No major injury reported.
On September 19, 2019, Boko Haram looted one shop in Kolofata, and stole goods.
On September 19, 2019, Boko Haram attacked the locality of Kouyape, resulting in clashed with Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-). 5 people were killed including 1 civilian and 4 militants.
On September 19, 2019, Military Forces of Cameroon "stopped" an attempted attack by Boko Haram in Soueram. Details limitied; extent of violence between the actors is not known.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: On September 17, 2019, Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion repelled an armed incursion by Boko Haram in Cheripouri.
On September 17, 2019, Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) repelled an attack by Boko Haram in Manawadji, killing 10 militants.
On September 16, 2019, Boko Haram attacked Zamga (Zanga), and stole small ruminants and clothes. No casualities.
On September 16, 2019, Ambazonian Separatists allegedly killed one woman in Guzang, in the Nord-Ouest province. Ambazonian Separatists denied this.
On September 15, 2019, Boko Haram attacked the village of Krawa Mafa, setting fire to 40 houses and looting goats and sheep. No reported casualities.
In the night of September 14 to 15, 2019, Boko Haram attacked a post of Military Forces of Cameroun (1982-) in Soueram. 5 military were killed and 8 others injured.
13 September. Boko Haram attacked civilians in Goumouldi, Kolofata. 2 civilians were killed in the attack.
13 September. Boko Haram abducted and killed 2 civilian farmers in Kerawa, Kolofata. Two civilians were killed in the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 11 September. Military forces attacked civilians in Mutengene, Fako. 2 civilians were killed in this attack.
09 September. Women demonstrated against police forces in Tombel, Kupe-Manenguba, against the mass arrest of their husbands. [size=no report]
08 September. Military forces shot and killed a civilian in Bambui, Tubah during operations against Ambazonian separatists.
08 September. Boko Haram attacked civilians in Galbiduh, Kolofata. 4 civilians were abducted and killed.
08 September. Boko Haram and military forces clashed in Bakouna, near Zigague, Logone-Et-Chari following at attempted attack on civilians.
08 September. Boko Haram attacked civilians in Talkoumri area of Kolofata, Mayo-Sava. 4 civilians were killed in the attack.
07 September. Boko Haram clashed with military forces at Tchebe-Tchebe military base, Mokolo. Boko Haram were able to steal a significant amount of ammunition. No reported casuality.
07 September. Boko Haram militants killed a civilian and assaulted 3 other women in Mozogo, Mayo Moskota.
On or before 07 September. Boko Haram abducted 2 women from Bourvare village near Kerawa, Kolofata. They were released 07 September.
07 September. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians in Satomi, Kolofata. No casualities reported.
07 September. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians in Bia, Kolofata. No casualities reported.
07 September. Boko Haram militants steal livestock from civilians in Madakar, Mayo Moskota.
06 September. Boko militants attacked civilians in Bargaram, Hile Alifa. Casualities unknown.
04 September. A group carried out mob justice by beating alleged thieves in Douala, Wouri. Police forces intervened by firing tear gas, shots into the air, and making arrests. [size=no report]
04 September. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians and stole goods from Kordo, Kolofata. 1 man was killed in the attack.
03 September. A radio presenter was kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists on the outskirts of Buea, Buea subdivision, Fako. Separatists burned some of the radio station buildings during the abduction.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 03 September. Ambazonian separatists and military BIR forces clashed in Nchouboh area of Bamenda 2. 4 separatists and a soldier were killed in the clash.
03 September. Boko Haram forces raided goods from civilians in Kolofata, Mayo-Sava.
02 September. Ambazonian separatists enforced a city "lock-down" by firing shots and forcing civilians to flee the streets in Bamenda, Mezam. Some explosions were also heard by residents.
02 September. An unidentified armed group fired shots and forced civilians to flee in Kumbo, Jakiri.
02 September. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians in Mozogo, Mayo Moskota.
02 September. Boko Haram militants abducted a woman and looted from civilians in Zelevet, Mokolo.
02 September. Boko Haram looted goods from stores and homes in Mozogo, Mayo Moskota.
01 September. Ambazonian separatists clashed with military forces in Kumba, Ndian. 4 were killed in the clash.
31 August. Ambazonian separatists abducted a Marine from Ekona, Muyuka and demanded a ransom for his release.
30 August. Boko Haram militants attacked and abducted civilian farmers from Bouvare, near Kolofata, Mayo-Sava. One civilian was beaten into a coma, while 8 were abducted.
30 August. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians in Mora, Mayo-Sava. 5 were killed in the attack.
30 August. Boko Haram militants abducted 15 children and destroyed 758 homes in Amchide, Kolofata.
29 August. Military forces burned houses in Bongom village near Nkambe, Misaje as part of eradication efforts against Ambazonian separatists.
29 August. Military forces attacked civilians and looted goods in Ewelle, Eyumodjock. 3 civilians were killed, 1 injured and 11 arrested.
29 August. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians in Kordo, Kolofata. 1 man was wounded and goods were stolen during the attack.
29 August. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians in Tolkomari, Kolofata. One woman was wounded and livestock was stolen.
Early in the week of 28 August. Ambazonian separatists clashed with military forces in Ako, Donga-Mantung. 4 Ambazonian separatists and an informant were killed during the fighting.
28 August. Ambazonian separatists enforced the widespread lock-down condition by burning and vandalizing vehicles which use the roads in Ndop.
27 August. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians in Amtchoukouli, Fotokol. 2 civilians were killed in the attack.
25 August. Ambazonian separatists clashed with police forces in Ndop, Ngo-ketunjia. 3 civilians were killed during the fighting.
25 August. Boko Haram militants looted goods from several ground nut plantations near Mozogo, Mayo Moskota.
25 August. A Fulani ethnic militia group attacked civilians in Wum, Menchum. 7 civilians were killed in the attack, including some bible translators, and others were injured.
24 August. Military forces attack civilians in Batim, Bui. 3 civilians were killed and homes were destroyed.
24 August. Military forces attacked and killed 3 civilians in Batim village, Noni. Many civilians fled the village following the attack.
24 August. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians and looted goods in Tolkomari, Kolofata. One civilian was wounded.
On or before 23 August. A farmer was killed by an unidentified armed group and found dead on the road between Fotokol and Bodo, Logone-Et-Chari.
23 August. Boko Haram militants stole goods from shops in Kerawa, Kolofata.
22 August. 3 children were abducted and livestock stolen by Boko Haram militants in Krawa Mafa, Mayo Moskota.
22 August. Boko Haram militants looted civilians in Blabline, Logone-Birni.
22 August. Boko Haram militants clashed with a communal militia in Kerawa, Kolofata after Boko Haram members attempted to loot shops in the area.
21 August. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clashed in Bamenda, Mezam. One civilian was killed during the fighting by a soldier.
21 August. Military forces attack civilians by lighting homes on fire and forcing them inside in Banga Bakundu, Meme. Soldiers burned 4 civilians to death.
21 August. Boko Haram looted goods from Zelevet, Mokolo. Civilians flee from the area during the incursion.
20 August. Boko Haram militants abducted 12 civilians traveling by bus on the road between Tchaode and Mikditere near Dabanga, Logone Birni. One civilian was killed and a few others escaped.
20 August. Ambazonian separatists attacked civilians, firing shots, assaulting civilians and forcing civilians to flee in Bamenda, Mezam.
20 August. Boko Haram and military forces clashed in Sandawadjiri, Kolofata. 1 Boko Haram militant was killed during the fighting.
17 August. Boko Haram militants stole goods from civilians in Kolofata, Mayo-Sava.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 15 August. Cameroon BIR soldiers were hit by an IED set by Ambazonian separatists in Kumba, Ekondo Titi. Several soldiers were wounded in the event. The army denies there was an IED, but simply poor roads.
13 August. Boko Haram militants looted goods from civilians in Kolofata, Mayo-Sava.
13 August. A group of construction workers building the new stadium in Yaounde demonstrated over lack of salaries for over 6 months. [size=no report]
13 August. An alleged thief was caught by an angry group of "quarter boys" in Yaounde, Mfoundi who beat the thief for stealing a bicycle. [size=no report]
12 August. Military forces attacked civilians, looted goods and destroyed property in Babanki, Belo. 2 civilians were killed during the attack.
12 August. Military forces attacked civilians in Muyuka, Fako. One civilian was killed and another seriously injured during the attack, with many shots fired indiscriminately.
10 August. Boko Haram militants attacked women and children in Ngoumoudi, near Mora, Mayo-Sava. 2 women were killed, 3 injured and 1 infant injured.
On or before 10 August. Ambazonian separatists abducted two Catholic priests from Kikaikom, Kumbo. One was released soon afterwards.
10 August. A Christian pastor was abducted by an unidentified armed group on the road to Kumbo, Jakiri.
09 August. The Fon traditional leader and another civilian were kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists in Ntumbaw, Ndu.
06 August. Boko Haram militants clash with a communal militia in Kouyape, Mayo Moskota. Stolen goods are recovered by the communal militia.
05 August. Boko Haram militants attacked and beheaded 4 civilians in Guederou, Kolofata.
05 August. Boko Haram militants clash with military forces in the Yabogo area of Amchide, Kolofata, killing one Boko Haram militant.
05 August. A Boko Haram female militant wearing a suicide vest is killed by military forces, presumably before detonation, in Double, Mora.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 04 August. Ambazonian separatists clashed with military BIR forces, killing one civilian and one BIR.
02 August. Military forces clashed with Boko Haram militants in Nguetchewe, Koza. 3 Boko Haram militants were killed in the fighting.
01 August. Boko Haram attacked civilians in Guederou, Kolofata, killing 4 civilians and stealing livestock.
01 August. Military forces attacked civilians, burned houses and stole goods from civilians in Gungong village (no coordinates available), near Bali, Mezam.
31 July. Civilians on a motorcycle hit a landmine planted by Boko Haram in the Bakarisse area of Kerawa, Kolofata. 2 of the civilians were injured and sent to Mora for treatment.

actor1: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Cameroon); MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
notes: 23 July - August 4. Around 100 prisoners, including some MRC opposition party members, were beaten with clubs, electric cables and machetes by prison guards and gendarmerie in Yaounde, Mfoundi.

30 July. An unidentified armed group threw a grenade into a bar in the Tsinga area of Yaounde, Mfoundi. The grenade wounded several in the bar. Some government reports found this was a deep fat fryer which caused the explosion.
30 July. Boko Haram attacked and killed two civilians in Dakara (no coordinates available), a village near Kerawa, Kolofata.
29 July. Cameroon military forces clash with Ambazonian separatists in Donga-Mantung region in the Nord-Ouest, killing 4 separatists.
29 July. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clashed in Ndop, Ngo-ketunjia, killing 4 separatists and recovering weapons in response fighting to the attack on the governor's convoy.
29 July. Boko Haram clashed with a communal militia before they attacked and tortured several female civilians by cutting off their ears in Karagari, Mora.
28 July. Boko Haram and military forces clashed in the Kolofata region of Mayo-Sava, Extreme-Nord, killing 4 Boko Haram members.
28 July. Boko Haram attacked civilians in Gakara, Kolofata, killing 2 civilians during the attack.
28 July. Military forces shot and killed 9 civilians, many of them farmers, in Nkongo area of Eyumodjock, Manyu.
28 July. Boko Haram and military forces clashed during a Boko Haram raid in Sandawadjiri, Kolofata. Military forces were able to recover some of the stolen livestock.
On or before 28 July. Military forces arrested and killed a civilian, leaving his body in Muyuka, Fako.
27 July. 2 gendarmes tortured a lawyer in Yaounde, Mfoundi which may have connections to a case he was working on.
27 July. Boko Haram clashed with a communal militia in Kangleri, Mora, decapitating and killing 3 of the communal militia members as well as looting property.
25 July. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians between Kouyape and Goudoumboul, Mayo-Sava, killing 2 civilians and abducting 4 others.
25 July. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clashed in Banga Bakundu village in Meme (no coordinates available). Fatalities unknown, coded as 10.
On or before 25 July. Military forces tortured two civilians in Weh village in Menchum.
24 July. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians in Kouyape, Mayo Moskota, killing 1, abducting 4 others and stealing livestock.
24 July. Boko Haram militants fired shots at civilians and looted goods from Guederou, Kolofata.

assoc_actor_1: Prisoners (Cameroon); MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
actor2: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Prison Guards
notes: 23 July. Prisoners violently demonstrated in Buea against prison guards, burning areas of the prison. 43 prisoners and 2 guards are injured following the riot. [size=at least 43]

assoc_actor_1: Prisoners (Cameroon); MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
actor2: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Prison Guards
notes: 22 July. Prisoners violently demonstrated in Yaounde at the Kondengui prison with prison guards intervening. Many prisoners are MRC members. [size=at least 77]
22 July. Boko Haram looted livestock from civilians in the Adamari area of Fotokol, Hile Alifa.
21 July. Ambazonian separatists clashed with gendarme forces who were inspecting a mine in Aiyomojok, Manyu, killing a gendarme and 4 separatists.
21 July. Boko Haram militants attack civilians in Amchide, Mayo-Sava. One civilian is found dead after the attack.
19 July. An unidentified armed group abducted a civilian warrant officer in the Ntamulung area of Bamenda, Mezam.
19 July. Military forces shot dead at leat three civilians in Rifem, Bui Division (no coordinates available) in the North West region. Reports indicate that the soldiers were on their way to Mbiame.

Around 19 July 2019. A man was beaten to death by Separatists in Kubma for organizing a march in the town a few days earlier. He was accused of betraying the Ambazonian cause after allegedly receiving money from the Senior Divisional Officer.
19 July. Military forces liberate hostage civilians from Boko Haram during a clash in Hile Alifa, Logone-Et-Chari.
18 July. Boko Haram clashed with military forces in Tchalagatari, Mayo Moskota. 2 Boko Haram militants were killed in the fighting.
18 July. A boy was shot dead in Bambui subdivision in the North West region of Cameroon by military forces who were searching for separatists.
Around 18 July 2019. Five Ambazonian militants armed with assault type weapons, sticks and cables attacked and beat three women in Bali accusing them of spying on them.
17 July. Military forces clashed with Ambazonian separatists in Bui region in the Nord-Ouest, killing 5 separatists and one soldier.
17 July. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clashed in Mbiam, Babessi. One soldier and 5 separatists are killed, along with 3 soldiers injured and seven vehicles destroyed.
17 July. An unidentified armed group abducted a lawyer, who defends Ambazonian separatists, from his house in Bamenda, Mezam.
17 July. Protesters demonstrated in Tourou, Mokolo against the ongoing insecurity in their area, accusing the military of causing the instability. [size=no report]
17 July. 2 children were killed and 3 others wounded by a grenade left by an unidentified armed group in Sahakh village near Bargaram, Hile Alifa.
17 July. Two doctors were abducted by an unidentified armed group in Bamenda and released 24 hours later.
17 July. Boko Haram militants attacked Zeleve and stole several items of value.
17 July. Boko Haram militants attacked Krawa-Mafa and stole several items of value.
17 July. Boko Haram militants attacked Bavangola (no coordinates available, in Mayo Mosko area) and stole several items of value. They killed two civilians.
16 July. A group of soldiers beat a group of taxi-moto drivers and burned their motorcycles in Ndokati, Yabassi.
Month of July. Military forces and Ambazonian separatists clashed in Etoko village near Mamfe, Manyu. Several homes are burned during military raids searching for separatists.
Month of July. Unidentified armed groups, which include Ambazonian separatists and military forces, kill 10 civilian pastoralists in Wum, Menchum.
15 July. Military forces attacked and killed a civilian in Njong village, Santa. They also burned homes and killed livestock.
15 July. Police forces arrested more than 50 civilians from Muea and Ekona villages following the killing of a soldier in this area during fighting with Ambazonian separatists.
15 July. Boko Haram and military forces clashed in Amchide, Kolofata.
15 July. Military forces clashed with Ambazonian separatists in Muea, Buea, killing one soldier and 3 separatists.
Late 13 July to 14 July. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians in Zelevet, Mokolo, killing 1 civilian and injuring 2 others.
14 July. Boko Haram looted goods and burned houses in Yegoua, Mayo-Tsanaga.
13 July. Ambazonian separatists abducted 30 civilians in Belo from buses traveling between Bamenda and Fundong.
13 July. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians outside Fotokol, Hile Alifa, in Madina. One civilian is killed, one kidnapped and livestock stolen.
13 July. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians in the Choloba neighborhood of Fotokol, Hile Alifa, seriously injuring 2 civilians.
13 July. An unidentified armed group, which may be Boko Haram, attacked civilians in the Naga area near Tika, Diamare. Goods were also stolen are taken back towards Nigeria.
13 July. Protesters from Mayo-Tsanaga demonstrate in Mokolo, Mayo-Tsanaga against the lack of government protection from Boko Haram. [size=no report]
12 July. Boko Haram and military forces clashed in Geldavi, Mayo Moskota. There were no casualties but 5 buildings were burned.

actor1: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: Women (Cameroon); Prisoners (Cameroon); MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
notes: On and before 11 July. Prison guards attacked, tortured and beat MRC supporters, including women, in Yaounde, Mfoundi. Prisoners were arrested during protests in early June.
11 July. An unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian in Amchide, Kolofata.
11 July. Military forces clash with Ambazonian separatists in Essu, Fungom. 7 separatists were killed in the fighting.
10 July. Boko Haram looted goods and destroyed buildings in Tourou, Mokolo.
10 July. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Alachu area of Bamenda, Mezam. 2 civilians are killed in security operations with another killed by a stray bullet during the fighting.
09 July. Gendarme forces and Ambazonian separatists clashed in Bamessing, Ndop. 2 Gendarme were killed and three others injured in the fighting.
07 September. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians and looted goods in Madakar, Mayo Moskota. One woman was seriously injured in the attack.
08 July. A soldier fired shots at a civilian during an altercation in Mokolo, Mayo-Tsanaga. A gendarme stopped further action by the soldier, but it is unclear if the shots hit the civilian.
07 July. Boko Haram and military forces clashed in Zelevet, Mokolo after a raid by Boko Haram in this area. 2 civilians were injured and a motorcycle was stolen.
07 July. An unidentified armed group abducted a Christian pastor from Buea. He was released on 10 July.
06 July. Boko Haram and military forces clashed in Gtia Wulgo, Longone-Et-Chari. 2 military forces are severely injured during the fighting.
05 July. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians, burned houses and looted goods in Geldavi, Mayo Moskota. 1 civilian was killed and two severely injured in the attack.
04 July. Ambazonian separatists clashed with military forces in Bamenda, Mezam. Military forces attacked and killed a civilian following the killing of a soldier during the fighting.
03 July. Around 30 Ambazonian separatists clashed with military forces after separatists ambushed a transport boat in the Ekpambiri area of Manyu. Several soldiers are injured.
02 July. One child is killed and 2 others wounded by a bomb explosion in Liabelem, Sud-Ouest.
01 July. A civilian was killed by military forces in Mpundu Balong, Muyuka as they suspected the victim of being a separatist.
01 July. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clashed in Batibo, Momo leaving several casualties on both sides (Coded as 10).
01 July. Military forces clashed with Ambazonian separatists in Kumbo, Jakiri.
01 July. Boko Haram militants attacked civilians in Nguetchewe, Mayo-Tsanaga (no further details available).
30 June. A civilian was killed by military forces in Bamenda, Mezam.

28 June. Chairman of the SDF, John Ndi Fru Ndi, was abducted by an unidentified armed group in Bamenda, Mezam. The attackers also shot his guard in the leg during the abduction. This was his second abduction in recent months.
28 June. Boko Haram militants attacked two civilians and abducted two others in Krawa, Mayo-Tsanaga.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 27 June. Boko Haram forces coming from Nigeria clashed with Cameroon BIR military forces at the border town of Moussafari (no coordinates available) near Double-Alagarno, Mayo-Sava. BIR forces recovered stolen livestock from Boko Haram forces.
25 June. Ambazonian separatists abducted a civilian, the Archbishop of Bamenda, near Belo, Boyo. He was released the next day.
On or before 24 June. Military forces killed 2 civilians after removing them from their homes and shooting them in Mbiam, Babessi.
23 June. Ambazonian separatists burned and destroyed two vehicles carrying World Food Programme food aid in Mezam, Nord-Ouest.
23 June. Boko Haram members abducted and killed 2 civilians in Amchide, Kolofata.
23 June. Boko Haram clashed with military forces during an ambush near Waliassi and Wambashe areas, Kolofata. 1 soldier was killed in the fighting.
22 June. 2 civilians are stabbed and killed by Boko Haram members in Amchoukouli village in Fotokol, Hile Alifa.
22 June. Boko Haram clashed with a local militia in Malia, Waza. Two civilians were injured in the fighting.
21 June. A soldier was killed during a clash with Boko Haram, between Waliassi and Wambashe, Kolofata.
21 June. Military forces attacked and killed a civilian in Mbah village, Nsoh (no coordinates available) in the Nord-Ouest region.
21 June. Boko Haram combatants attacked and killed 2 civilian farmers in Makary, Logone-Et-Chari.
21 June. Boko Haram members attacked 6 fisherman on a boat near the island of Bouaram, Darak. One fisherman escaped, while the other 5 were killed.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 21 June. BIR and military forces killed a civilian and raped a woman in Kumbo, Bui.
20 June. Boko Haram forces, force pastoralists in Ngouma to bury their dead, loot their livestock, and then kill some of the civilians. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
20 June. Boko Haram forces looted a village in the Kolofata area of Mayo-Sava.
19 June. Military forces defused a land mine planted by Boko Haram in Kolofata zone of Mayo-Sava.
19 June. Military forces clashed with Boko Haram forces in Ngouma, Hile Alifa, capturing 1 Boko Haram member, recovering goods and weapons and killing 3 Boko Haram members.
19 June. Ambazonian separatists abducted 6 vehicles on the road between Wum and Bamenda in Menchum. They are beaten and released the next day.
18 June. Boko Haram members abducted 4 civilians from Afade, Makary in Logone-Et-Chari. 1 civilian was later found dead.
18 June. Boko Haram members abducted 4 civilians and looted goods in Boungour village of Makari (no coordinates available).
18 June. Ambazonian separatists abducted 40 civilian road workers outside of Wum on the Wum-Bafut-Bamenda road near Mile 24. They are beaten and released the next day.
17 June. Boko Haram steals livestock from civilians in Tchika, Hile Alifa.
17 June. Police forces clash with Ambazonian separatists in Mamfe, Manyu, killing one police officer.
17 June. Military forces burn civilian homes in Bai Panya, Meme in ongoing operations against Ambazonian separatists.

One day between 16-18 June. Ambazonian separatists clashed with military forces in several villages of Mbengwi of Momo including Njindom, Barakwe and Nyen (no coordinates available) around Miles 19 and 20.
On or before 16 June. A man is found dead in Domayo Bololo quarter of Maroua in Diamare, which some suspect may have been a Boko Haram attack.
16 June. Boko Haram members burn houses and steal goods from civilians in Menensoe, Fotokol.
15 June. Boko Haram members clashed with military forces in Ngouma, Hile Alifa, killing 3 Boko Haram members.
15 June. A police vehicle hit a land mine planted by Ambazonian separatists in Eyumojock, Manyu, killing 4 and injuring 3.
14 June. Military forces attack civilians and burn homes in Akwese village, Ako (no coordinated available). 4 civilians were killed, 6 homes burned, and many others fled to Nigeria.

14 June. Military forces detained 10 farmers suspected to be Ambazonian separatists in Babanki, Boyo. The security forces killed 6 of them, burying the bodies nearby. The other 4 may still be detained, as no bodies were found.
13 June. Boko Haram members attacked civilians and pillaged goods from Tagawa, Waza. Two civilians were killed and 2 others injured.
13 June. Military forces shoot and killed a civilian, in Santa of Mezam.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 12 June. BIR forces and Boko Haram members clash in Kolofata of Mayo-Sava after Boko Haram attempted to raid shops. At least three Boko Haram combatants were killed in the clash, while some sources. Indicate four.
12 June. Ambazonian separatists abducted a civilian in Bamenda, Mezam.
12 June. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Hausa Quarter in Santa, Mezam, killing one separatist.
10 June. Boko Haram members killed 2 merchants on the route between Amchide and Kolofata.
10 June. Ambazonian separatists clashed with military forces in the Bui region of the Nord-Ouest. Eight separatists and one soldier were killed.

source: Journal du Cameroun; UN (unspecified); Mimi Mefo; L'Oeil
notes: Night of 09 June. Around 300 Boko Haram members clash with military forces, destroy property, loot and kill civilians around Lake Chad in Darak, Diamare. 16 soldiers , 8 civilians and 64 Boko Haram members killed, with many others injured. 7 soldiers are missing and 15 Boko Haram combatants were arrested by military forces.
09 June. Military forces attacked civilians and burned homes in Essu, Menchum. Twelve civilians were killed during attacks on the town from 07-09 June. (Fatalities are spread across events).
09 June. Military forces attacked civilians in Weh (Zoa), Menchum. One civilian was killed in the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 09 June. A BIR soldier opened fire on 2 moto taxi drivers, killing one, in Moroua, Diamare. The BIR soldier flees to a local police station after upset taxi-moto drivers pursue him, upset about the death of a colleague.
06 September. Ambazonian separatists abducted 2 civilians from Baligham, Mezam.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 06 September. ISWAP/Boko Haram forces fired rounds and "stormed" the market in Bargaram, Hile Alifa. One civilian was killed while fleeing the attack.
08 June. Military forces and Boko Haram members clash in Nguetchewe of Mayo-Tsanaga.

assoc_actor_1: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
notes: 08 June. MRC supporters demonstrated calling for the release of Maurice Kamto as part of "white marches" in Yaounde. Police intervened to disperse the protest, beating some and arresting around 200 people. [size=at least 200]
08 June. Military forces attacked civilians and burned homes in Essu, Menchum. Twelve civilians were killed during attacks on the town from 07-09 June. (Fatalities are spread across events).
08 June. A woman was killed by Boko Haram, during an attack in Kolofata, Mayo-Sava.
08 June. Boko Haram members attacked civilians in Nguetchewe, Mayo-Tsanaga, killing 2.
08 June. Military forces attacked and kill 8 civilians in Ekona, Muyuka. The soldiers accused the victims of being Ambazonian separatists.
08 June. Two girls were abducted by Ambazonian separatists in Nkwen, Mezam. The girls were beaten and released three days later after a ransom was paid.
07 June. Military forces attacked civilians and burned homes in Essu, Menchum. Twelve civilians were killed during attacks on the town from 07-09 June. (Fatalities are spread across events).
06 June. A mob riots and injures a gendarme soldier who killed a taxi driver in Bafoussam of Mifi. [size=no report]
06 June. A gendarme soldier shoots and kills a taxi driver while in pursuit of another vehicle in Bafoussam of Mifi.
04 June. Military forces attack and kill 3 civilians suspected of being Ambazonian separatists in Balikumbat of Ngo-ketunjia.

03 June. Hausa and Aku militia attack Fulani civilians in Naikom and Waindo areas of Wum, with military forces standing by to allow the attack. The armed group kills 2, wounds 5 others and destroys several buildings including the palaces in Naikom and Waindo. Aghem claim these were retaliatory attacks for separatist attacks in their village.
02 June. Ambazonian separatists attack civilians and destroy houses in Aghem area of Wum, killing one civilian.

assoc_actor_1: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
notes: 01 June. MRC protesters demonstrate in Yaounde of Mfoundi for the release of Maurice Kamto, with police dispersing protesters with water canons. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
notes: 01 June. MRC protesters demonstrate in Yaounde of Mfoundi for the release of Maurice Kamto, with police intervening and making arrests. [size=at least 300 between all protests on the same day]

assoc_actor_1: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
notes: 01 June. MRC protesters demonstrate in Douala of Wouri for the release of Maurice Kamto, with police dispersing protesters with water canons and making arrests. [size=at least 300 between all protests on the same day]

assoc_actor_1: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
notes: 01 June. MRC protesters demonstrate in Bafoussam of Mifi for the release of Maurice Kamto, with police dispersing protesters and making arrests. [size=at least 300 between all protests on the same day]
01 June. Boko Haram members abducted a young boy near Tourou and Ngosi, Mokolo during cattle raids.
30 June. Ambazonian separatists attack civilian refugees in Upkwa Resettlement Camp near Lake Nyos in Wum. Separatists attack civilians and burn around 40 homes. No casualties reported.
27 May. Boko Haram members attack civilians and steal goods in Choloba of Fotokol, killing 1 civilian.
27 May. A Boko Haram suicide bomber detonates a suicide vest in Magdeme of Mora after being stopped by a communal militia, killing the bomber and injuring other civilians.
26 May. Police forces clash with 2 Ambazonian separatists attempting to smuggle arms on a bus from Bomako to Buea in Fako. 2 Ambazonian separatists die in the clash.
25 May. Military forces shoot and kill 5 civilians from the same family in Sang area of Bali in Mezam, with 2 others injured. Some civilians in the area flee into hiding.
25 May. Boko Haram members attack civilians on the island of Boram on Lake Chad in Blangoua. 1 civilian is killed and several injured.
24 May. Ambazonian separatists abduct three teachers and steal goods from Bakweri Town area of Buea in Fako, demanding a ransom for their release.
23 May. Military forces clash with Ambazonian separatists in Essu of Fungom, with 9 deaths recorded following the clash including civilian casualties.
23 May. Military forces kill a civilian moto-taxi driver, injure others, shoot indiscriminately and burn motorcycles at Mile 90 of Bamenda in Mezam.
23 May. Military forces kill a civilian moto-taxi driver in Kumba of Ekondo Titi, suspected of connections with Ambazonian separatists.
22 May. Boko Haram members clash with military forces in Sagme of Hile Alifa. No deaths or injuries reported.
22 May. Boko Haram abducts a man from a rural part of Gouderi of Kolofata, taking him towards the Nigerian border.
22 May. Boko Haram attack civilians in Malika of Mora, killing one and injuring others.
22 May. Boko Haram members attack civilians and steal goods 4 kilometers from Talkomari in Kolofata. 1 civilian is killed in the attack
22 May. Around 60 civilians are arrested by police and gendarme forces in Buea of Fako, suspected to be Ambazonian separatists.

21 May. Military forces clash with Boko Haram members in Ardori, near Bonderi of Kolofata. 1 civilian and 1 soldier are killed in the fighting, as well as a Boko Haram member shot (coded as an injury) and buildings burned.
21 May. Ambazonian separatists kill and dismember a teacher in Bamenda of Mezam.
21 May. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Nkwen of Mezam, with a soldier killed and dismembered in the clash.
21 May. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Santa of Mezam, forcing civilians to flee or stay indoors.
20 May. Boko Haram members clash with military forces in Ardori of Mora, with one serious injury reported.
20 May. Military forces clash with Ambazonian separatists in Kumbo of Jakiri. One separatist and a civilian are killed in the fighting, as well as another civilian injured.

20 May. Military forces and Ambazonian separatists clash in Bamenda of Mezam. Military forces shoot and kill a civilian bar owner in Old Town area with shooting heard near Hotspot area in Up-Station as well.
20 May. Ambazonian separatists clash with military forces in Buea of Fako.
20 May. Military forces shoot and kill a civilian in Leo village near Ekondo Titi and Mundemba of Ndian.
20 May. Military forces clash with Ambazonian separatists in Kumba of Ekondo Titi.
19 May. A police officer drops a grenade into a crowd of civilians in a bar at the Pont Vert area of Maroua of Diamare. 1 civilian is killed and around 25 injured.
19 May. Police arrests "hundreds" of civilians in Marche Congo area of Douala before May 20 National Day. Civilians may be linked to opposition parties.
19 May. Military forces clash with Ambazonian separatists in Mantum village of Jakiri in Bui.

19 May. Gunshots in Balikumbat of Ngo-ketunjia are exchanged, likely between ongoing fighting between Ambazonian separatists and military forces, following the raising of the Ambazonian flag and grandstands being painted Ambazonian colours.
19 May. Military forces shoot and kill a child in Muyuka of Fako during military operations in the area.
One day between 14 and 21 May. Boko Haram attack civilians in Malika of Mora. No casualties reported.
18 May. Military forces shoot and kill 12 people in Ebam of Eyumojock in Manyu.
18 May. Military forces shoot and kill 6 civilians, burn houses and make arrests in Nchang of Mamfe.
16 May. Ambazonian separatists clash with military forces in Molyko and Dirty South areas of Buea.
16 May. 30 Ambazonian separatists surrender to military forces in Kumba of Ekondo Titi.
16 May. A civilian vehicle detonates a mine, likely planted by Boko Haram, killing 2 people and injuring 2 others.
14-19 May. Military forces fire shots and loot houses, businesses and government buildings in Kumbo of Jakiri, forcing civilians to flee.

15 May. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Mankon of Bamenda 2. Separatists kill 2 soldiers, while a civilian is killed by military forces. A clinic and scores of houses are burned in the fighting by military forces and indiscriminate shooting reported.
22 May. 3 brothers abducted by Boko Haram earlier in the year were found dead in Greya of Maroua 2.
15 May. Boko Haram members loot motorcycles and other property from Milka area of Mora in Mayo-Sava. No deaths or injuries reported.
Mid-May. Ambazonian separatists tortured a civilian at an abandoned school in Bali, Mezam. Separatists forced the man to sit on burning paper in his underwear and beat him with machetes and sticks.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 13 May. Boko Haram members clash with military BIR in Amchide of Kolofata.
13 May. Military forces shooting sporadically to disperse a crowd, injuring a woman at the Tu Ngandeh Market in Nkambe of Donga-Mantung.
13 May. Military forces shoot and kill a 14 year old boy in his home in Mbakem of Akwaya, mistaken for an Ambazonian separatist.

12 May. Military forces and Boko Haram members clash in Sakme of Logone-et-Chari, killing 3 military soldiers and "several" Boko Haram members. Boko Haram members steal equipment and vehicles following the clash. "Several" coded as 10.
11 May. Boko Haram members attack civilians, as well as steal goods and cattle, in Dissalam of Fotokol. One civilian killed in the attack.
11 May. Boko Haram members clash with military forces in Goshi town in Mokolo of Maya-Tsanagaburn, burning 67 homes, 11 stores and a church. 1 Boko Haram member is killed in the clash.
10 May. Ambazonian separatists clash with military forces in Mah village of Nkum, setting houses on fire and forcing civilians to flee. No casualties reported.
10 May. Women's group, WTF, protests against ongoing violence in English-speaking regions of Cameroon. [size=200]
09 May. Ambazonian separatists abduct 8 students, many female, from schools in Buea of Fako for violation of "dead zone" mandates, demanding payment for their release.
05 September. Boko Haram forces attacked civilians and looted goods from Kordo, Kolofata. One civilian was killed in the attack.
07 May. Two villages in Mokolo sub-division clash over a land dispute, killing 6 people, leaving 300 homeless and destroying property.

06 May. Ambazonian separatists clash with military forces in Bamnagam area of Bui, killing 2 separatists, injuring others and 2 missing following the fighting. Soldiers dismember the bodies of the separatists killed during the fighting.
06 May. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Santa of Mezam.
06 May. Police forces arrest over 200 civilians in Buea of Fako.

05 May. Military forces attack civilians during searches for Ambazonian separatists in Ntamruh and Ntayi villages of Ndu. 7 civilians are killed, 42 homes burned and 400 cows are reported missing following the attack.
Near 05 May. An unidentified armed group abducts a civilian called Zachee Nzongandembou, CEO of Eden Media Group. He is released on 05 May.
04 May. Ambazonian separatists clash with military forces at a military post in Dibonda of Mundemba, injuring 3 soldiers.
04 May. Soldiers kill a mother and child while firing indiscriminate shots searching for Ambazonian separatists in the town of Bambui of Tubah.
05 May. Military forces retaliate against Ambazonian separatists following an attack on a military post the day before, killing 17 separatists and recovering equipment.
03 May. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Wowo village of Ndu, killing 2 civilians in the fighting.
01 May. An unidentified armed group abducts 4 students from GBHS school in Mbefi quarter of Nkwen in Mezam,  demanding a ransom payment for their release.
01 May. Military forces shoot and kill a civilian in Mankon of Bamenda 2 returning from Labour Day festivities.
30 April. Military forces burn 9 homes in the Tsenla area of Kikaikelaki (approx 5km north of Kumbo) in operations to find Ambazonian separatists, causing many civilian to flee.
30 April. Military forces clash with Ambazonian separatists in Kokibue area of Babessi in Balikumbat, killing "several" separatists. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
29 April. Ambazonian separatists kill a police commissioner in Sabongari village in Donga-Mantung.

30 April. Military forces clash with Ambazonian separatists at separatist military camps in Wum and Echuan areas of Menchum, killing "several" separatists and 4 soldiers. Military forces also burn around 10 houses near the Ngoh public school. Total fatalities coded as 14.
28 April. Ambazonian separatists kidnap a civilian from Mantum village in Jakiri, releasing the civilian 2 days later after a ransom payment.

One night between 26-28 April. Boko Haram members clash with military forces on Kofia island of Lake Chad in Blangoua. 3 civilians and 1 soldier are killed and 5 are injured, as well as a military post burned and shops raided.
27 April. Boko Haram members attack civilians in Bourouvare area of Kolofata, killing one person.
26 April. A member of a communal militia group in Maloumri of Kolofata is killed in a clash with Boko Haram.
26 April. The SDF Senate Vice-President, Emilia Nkeze, is abducted by Ambazonian separatists in Bamenda of Mezam near the residence of SDF National Chairman Ni John Fru.
26 April. Military forces attack civilians in Ikata of Muyuka, killing 4 civilians, burning homes and causing other civilians to flee.

25 April. Obala and Haoussa communities clash using machetes and arrows, while others carry placards denouncing the lack of police intervention, in Obala of Lekie after the murder of a Haoussa man the day before.
24 April. Military forces clash with Ambazonian separatists in Muyuka of Fako. Ambazonian separatists abduct and kill a gendarme by dismembering and beheading him.
24 April. Ambazonian separatists burn the house of the mayor and Inspector General of Public Works in Ngwaikuma neighborhood on the outskirts of Fundong of Boyo.
24 April. Military forces burn four civilian homes in Wat village of Nkambe sub division in search of Ambazonian separatists, but there was no direct confrontation between armed groups.
24 April. A woman is abducted by Ambazonian separatists in Bambili of Mezam.
Week of 24 April. Ambazonian separatists behead a soldier in Bamenda of Mezam.

24 April. A man hailing from the Haoussa group was killed in Obala of Lekile in suspected communal violence. Clashes erupted between Obala and Haoussa communities the next day as a result (coded separately).
23 April. Four armed Ambazonian separatists break into a Saint Frederick high school in Bamenda of Mezam and abduct a civilian at gun point.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 23 April. Ambazonian separatists clash with BIR military forces in Kumbo of Jakiri after Ambazonian separatists attacked a military escort. 3 soldiers are wounded in the clash.
23 April. Prisoners in Mbouda Prison of Bamboutos protest over living conditions. 15 of the protesters were moved to the central prison in Bafoussam. [size=280]
22 April. Military forces attack civilians in several areas around Bafut, including Mambu, Manka'a, Nikong areas of Mbebali and Njinteh neighborhoods. Two civilians are killed and "tens" arrested.
22 April. Military forces attack civilians in Tole Tea area of Buea of Fako, beating civilians, making arrests and removing some from their homes.
22 April. More than 50 Boko Haram members attack civilians in Blangoua of Logone-Et-Chari, killing 8 civilians and injuring a dozen others.
22 April. Military forces attack civilians in Njenteh and Mbebali areas of Bafut in Mezam, killing one civilian allegedly part of Ambazonian separatists and arresting others.

22 April. More than 50 Boko Haram members clash with military forces near Blangoua of Logone-Et-Chari. After the initial confrontation, military forces search the area for any remaining Boko Haram members, causing civilians to flee the area.
22 April. Boko Haram members attack civilians in Madagascar area of Lake Chad near Blangoua, with 7 deaths recorded, 2 serious injuries and another slightly injured.
21 April. Ambazonian separatists abduct 3 civilians connected to SDF National Chairman, Ni John Fru in Bafut of Mezam, demanding money and guns as ransom.

20 April. Security forces burn a home in Malende area of Muyuka in Fako, causing neighbors to gather and retaliate with machetes, killing a member of the military forces. Many flee from the village in fear of military retaliation.
20 April. 8 Boko Haram members surrender to military forces in Bargaram of Hile Alifa. Two more surrendered on April 26th.
"One male national NGO staff member was kidnapped outside of his office in Buea town and held for several days by a non-state armed group active in the area."
18 April. Boko Haram members attack civilians, steal goods, and burn property in Tchakamari of Mayo-Sava, killing 7 civilians, injuring 5 others.
16 April. An unidentified armed group, which some suspect to be military forces, detonates an IED on a corpse, killing a civilian and wounding 2 others.
16 April. Boko Haram steal oxen from pastoralists in Maloumri of Kolofata. BIR respond late and are unable to intervene in the theft.
16 April. Boko Haram members kill 3 civilians in Kerawa of Kolofata while they are fetching firewood.
15 April. A street trader is abducted by an unidentified armed group in Kumba of Ekondo Titi.
15 April. Military forces burn civilians' houses in Luh village of Ndu in search of Ambazonian separatists.
15 April. Military forces clash with Ambazonian separatists in Kosala area of Kumba, killing "several" soldiers. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
In April, Ambazonian separatists abduct a woman from Fundong district as a wife for a separatist fighter, demanding a ransom for her release.

In April, unidentified armed groups abduct over 30 people from Jakiri subdivision of Bui, a region of ongoing fighting between Ambazonian separatists and military forces. Many civilians were released following ransom payments.
14 April. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Bali of Mezam, killing 3 separatists and 4 military soldiers.
Night of 13 April. Military forces clash with Boko Haram members in Sandawadjiri of Kolofata, killing 2 Boko Haram members.
Night of 13 April. Military forces kill a civilian while patrolling at Mile 14 Depanda near Douala of the Mutengene-Buea road.
13 April. A soldier is killed and 8 others injured when a vehicle passed over a landmine, planted by an unidentified armed group.
12 April. Boko Haram detonate an IED within a military vehicle, killing one person and injuring 8 others in Kerawa of Kolofata.
On or before 12 April. A farmer is beaten by military soldiers in Buea of Fako, forced to guide the soldiers to hideouts of Ambazonian separatists.
12 April. A group of 6 secondary school children are abducted in Fongo-Tongo area of Menoua by an unidentified armed group.
12 April. 4 soldiers are killed by Boko Haram after an IED was triggered near their vehicle near the axis of Vouzi-Vreket-Gouzda in Mayo Moskota.
11 or 12 April. Boko Haram forces invade Nigue of Goulfey, stealing goods and forcing civilians to flee.
12 April. Police forces torture and kill a civilian involved in telephone repair in Douala of Wouri.
10 April. Military forces kill a civilian thought to be providing spiritual protection to Ambazonian separatists and burn the neighborhood of Dohseh Leghi in Bamenda of Mezam.
10 April. Military forces of the FMM of Makary arrest 7 members of Boko Haram in Bargaram of Hile Alifa.

assoc_actor_1: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
notes: 09 April. Supporters of Maurice Kamto protest at the court in Yaounde of Mfoundi against his ongoing imprisonment and trial. Police arrest 18 people part of the protest. [size=scores]
09 April. The president of a local court is kidnapped by an unidentified armed group near Mile 15 in Buea of Fako.
08 April. Military forces kill the Fon of Fuh village in Ndu, after the traditional leader was accused of leading an Ambazonian rebel faction.
On or before 08 April. Ambazonian separatists raped a young girl in Mbandi of Ako, leaving her hospitalised.

06 or 07 April. Boko Haram forces clash with soldiers in Sagme of Hile Alifa. 3 soldiers were killed, 4 wounded and another missing following the clash. A number of Boko Haram militants were also neutralized (unknown coded as 10).
07 April (night of). An unidentified armed group, suspected to be Cameroon military forces, kills a civilian following overnight gunshots in Bulu Native area of Buea in Fako.

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: 07 April. Boko Haram faction of Islamic State clash with military forces in Fotokol of Hile Alifa, killing or injuring 20 soldiers. Unknown if dead or injured coded as 0 fatalities.
06 April. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Limbe of Fako at Mile 2. No casualties were reported.
05 April. A soccer coach is abducted by an unidentified armed group in Bamenda of Mezam. Reasons unclear.
Between 05-09 April. 2 soldiers are abducted and killed by Boko Haram members near Ardebe of Makary.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Gendarmerie; Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-)
notes: 04 April. Military forces, gendarmerie and police attack civilians, burn and bulldoze buildings and homes in Jerfon neighborhood of Meluf in Kumbo of Jakiri, forcing many civilians to flee. 5 civilians are killed, with some reports of mutilation and beheading.
03 April. A gendarme soldier attacks and kills a civilian in Muyuka of Fako, suspected of being an Ambazonian separatist.
02 April. A business person from Tiko of Fako was abducted and beaten by Ambazonian separatists, they released him after a ransom was paid.

02 April. Two Central African nationals attempt to steal motorcycles by attacking the moto drivers in Garoua of Bardanke. Riots erupt following the attempted theft, burning one of the thieves to death. [size=no report]
02 April. Military forces burn buildings in Mbipgo area of Ndu in Donga-Mantung as part of operations against separatists in the region.
01 April. Cameroon gendarme forces clash with Ambazonian separatists at the Kombe market in Penda Mboko of Fiko. 3 soldiers were shot and one police officer is missing following the battle.
01 April. Military and Gendarmerie forces attack civilians during searches for Ambazonian separatists at the Baptist Hospital Mbingo in Mbengo of Belo, killing a civilian and wounding another.
Early April. An international task force (presumably Cameroon and Nigerian military forces) clash with Boko Haram members in Ardebe, killing 5 fighters.
30 March. A group of pirates from Nigeria hijacked a Liberian ship and kidnapped the crew off of the coast of Cameroon. The ship continued after the abduction to the docks at Douala port.

actor1: Police Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Prison Guards
notes: 30 March. Prison guards torture civilians in prison with machetes in Menda Nkwe of Bamenda 1, suspected to be former Ambazonian separatists.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 29 March (or 30 March). Boko Haram and BIR military forces clash near Limani-Gourgui area of Kolofata, killing 2 Boko Haram members and retrieving military equipment.

29 March. An unidentified armed group sets fire to a residential building in the Coconut Island area of Limbe in Fako during a "ghost day", likely part of ongoing fighting between Ambazonian separatists and military forces.
28 March. A labour group demonstrates over unpaid wages at Paul Biya Stadium in Yaounde of Mfoundi. [size=no report]

28 March. Soldiers and Ambazonian separatists clash in Bakwelle village of Mamfe during ongoing security operations in the region. A civilian woman is killed, as well as some soldiers. "Some" coded as 10.
28 March. Soldiers kill 6 civilians in Wum of Menchum during widespread security operations in the region. 4 civilians are shot and 2 are killed through explosives planted on corpses.
28 March. Military forces and Ambazonian separatists clash at the Mbveh market in Kumbo of Jakiri.
27 March. Military forces fire shots at and clear civilians from Baptist Hospital Mbingo in Mbengo of Belo in order for soldiers to receive treatment following clashes with Ambazonian separatists.
26 March. Military forces pull residents from their homes, wound some and kill 5 civilians at the Old Bridge and market areas in Widikum of Widikum-Boffe.
26 March. Police forces clash with Ambazonian separatists in Mamfe of Manyu, killing 2 separatists.
25 March. An unidentified armed group abducted an IDP child in Douala of Wouri, demanding a ransom for the release.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 25 March. Ambazonian separatists and military BIR forces clash in Quarter 5 Bonadikombo of Limbe in Fako, with one BIR member killed in the fighting.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 25 March. Gunshots, likely between ongoing fighting between Ambazonian separatists and military forces, force civilians off the streets in Dibanda area of Buea.
25 March. "Massive" arrests of civilians throughout Buea in Bunduma, Great Soppo and Sand Pit in ongoing crackdowns against Ambazonian separatists.
25 March. Military forces burn 7 homes and a motorcycle during operations in Noi village of Jakiri of Bui, as part of ongoing operations against Ambazonian separatists.
25 March. Boko Haram attacks civilians in Zelevet of Mokolo, leaving one civilian severely injured and stealing food.
25 March. Military forces shoot a young student civilian in the legs while in Bali of Mezam, leaving major injuries.
24 March. Security forces arrest 17 Boko Haram members and seize weapons in Amchide of Kolofata.
24 March. Boko Haram forces attack civilians in Goulouzivini locality of Waza, killing a woman.
24 March. Boko Haram members attack Kerawa of Kolofata, wounding a civilian and destroying a classroom.
24 March. Military forces accuse a moto-taxi driver of being an Ambazonian separatist at Wainamah Medical Center in Jakiri of Bui, shooting and killing him.
23 March. Boko Haram attack civilians in Zagague of Waza, killing one civilian and stealing cattle.
21 March. A mental patient is killed by military forces during a raid on Mbessa of the Ouest region, along with the arson of 8 homes (coordinates are approximate based on govt maps)
21 March. Two civilians were killed by military forces in Ichim area of Oku in Belo.
21 March. Ongoing clashes between military forces and Ambazonian separatists forces civilians off the streets in Bamenda of Mezam.
21 March. Military forces set fire to several houses in Zongefu village in Wum of Menchum as part of widespread security operations against Ambazonian separatists.
21 March. Boko Haram attack Lake Chad locations near Waza of Logone-Et-Chari, kidnapping 1 fisherman, stealing over 700 cattle and forcing others to flee.
21 March. Military forces clash with the Red Dragon group of Ambazonian separatists in Mmock Mbie area of Alou in Lebialem, killing 3 separatists and destroying the camp.
20 March. 15 university student football players are kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Buea at the university sports grounds.
20 March. The former Secretary of State, Emmanuel Ngafeeson, is kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Bamenda of Mezam.
20 March. An unidentified armed group fire shots in Buea outside of a Christian group meeting place. Civilians hide on the floor to avoid being hit by bullets.
20 March. Ambazonian separatists and military forces clash in Bambalang of Ndop, killing 3 separatists and seizing weapons.
20 March. Ambazonian separatists clash with military forces in Mbveh area of Kumbo in Bui, killing 5 soldiers.
20 March. Demonstrators clash with military forces following the forced removal of a resident in Garoua of Bardanke. Military forces fire rounds to disperse the crowd, wounding 5 people. [size=crowd]
19 March. An unidentified armed group kidnaps a sports coach from Yong Sports Academy, Emmanuel Ndoumbe Bosso, in Bamenda of Mezam.
19 March. Suspected soldiers shoot a civilian dead in Likomba area of Tiko in the Fako region. The civilian may have had ties to the Ambazonian separatist group.
19 or 20 March. An unidentified armed group kills a catholic priest from Central African Republic in Ngaoundere of Vina.
18 March. Ambazonian separatists kidnap around 20 pineapple plantation workers in Ndo 3 area of Mbanga in the Moungo department and set fire to the plantation, destroying tools and other goods.
18 March. Boko Haram members kill a civilian during an attack on Goumouldi of Kolofata.
18 March. Protesters organised by ODS leader, Lilian Koulou Engoulou, demonstrate in Yaounde of Mfoundi against the US intervention in Cameroon internal affairs. [size=no report]
17-18 March. 20 Boko Haram members attack Tayer village in Mayo-Sava, killing 1 civilian and looting 7 shops.
18 March. Military forces attack civilians in Nkor of Bui accused of doing rituals to strengthen the Ambazonian separatists, shooting 3 men (it is unclear if the men died).
During the month of March. Military forces and Ambazonian separatists clash for three days (coded as March 15, 16, and 17th) in Essu, Fungom, forcing civilians to flee.
17 March. Military forces and Ambazonian separatists clash at Mile 4 on the road between Limbe and Bonadikumbo of Fako region. 2 soldiers and 1 separatist are killed in the clash.
17 March. 2 young civilians are killed by Boko Haram and property looted in Taya near Mora of Mayo-Sava.
17 March. Boko Haram members kill a civilian, wound another, steal livestock and displace people in Fotokol and Sabangali areas of Hile Alifa (coded as 2 events, fatalities coded for Fotokol)
17 March. Boko Haram members kill a civilian, wound another, steal livestock and displace people in Fotokol and Sabangali areas of Hile Alifa (coded as 2 events, fatalities coded for Fotokol)
During the month of March. Military forces and Ambazonian separatists clash for three days (coded as March 15, 16, and 17th) in Essu, Fungom, forcing civilians to flee.
16 March. Ambazonian separatists and police forces clash in Bamenda of Mezam. Separatists burn a police officer to death after capturing him.
16 March. Boko Haram attack Zelevet of Mokolo, killing 2 female civilians, taking another hostage, burning homes and stealing property.
16 March. Boko Haram kill 3 civilians in Sandawadjiri of Kolofata.
16 March. Nigerian military forces and Boko Haram members clash in Banki of Kolofata, leaving several wounded.
During the month of March. Military forces and Ambazonian separatists clash for three days (coded as March 15, 16, and 17th) in Essu, Fungom, forcing civilians to flee.
15 March. Cameroon military forces continue burning homes in several areas of Kumbo in Jakari. These are a part of further operations in Wum.
15 or 16 March. Boko Haram attack Tourou of Mokolo, burning several houses.
14 March. Journalists protest for peace in Buea of Fako, with reports of armed mayor and security forces injuring and arresting protesters. [size=no report]

14 March. Cameroon military forces set homes on fire in Wum of Menchum, killing 4 civilians who could not escape. Cameroon military forces claim these are part of operations to find Ambazonian separatists.
14 March. Three civilians were killed following an attack by Boko Haram in Sandawadjiri of Kolofata.
14 March. Military forces and Ambazonian separatists clash in Nkambe area, killing 3 soldiers and 2 separatists, wounding 6 others.

14 March (on or around). Soldiers kill 8 civilians and burn homes in Chup, Njap and Chad villages of Nkambe in Misaje during search operations following clashes with separatists (clash recorded separately).
11 March. Local residents of Belabo riot over electricity cuts and irregular supply by blocking roads and cutting down trees, with police intervening to stop the demonstration. [size=no report]
11 March. Members of Boko Haram kidnap the son of the village chief in Waro 2, at the outskirts of Sagme (3km). He is released two days later.
11 March. A civilian is killed by Boko Haram in Magam Arabe village between Fotokol and Bodo.
11 March. A soldier is killed by a landmine laid by Boko Haram in Wambatche of Mora.
11 March. Boko Haram members attack an area near Bodo and Magam Arabe of Hile Alifa on the route to Fotokol, killing 1 civilian.
09 March. A group of women protest near mile 4 of Limbe for the supply of potable water, with security forces breaking up the protest. [size=no report]
08 March. The traditional ruler, Fon Ta Nfor Nkwi, is kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists in Mpipgo village of Ndu in the North West region.

08 March. Ambazonian separatists and Cameroon military forces clash in Dom area of Nkor municipality, Bui division. 7 Ambazonian separatists are killed in the clash, as well as reports of houses burned by soldiers.
08 March. Shots are heard as part of ongoing fighting between Cameroon military forces and Ambazonian separatists, keeping residents from leaving their homes.
08 March. Boko Haram members steal several goods from a market in Amchide of Kolofata, including a motorcycle and bicycle.
Night of 06-07 March. Boko Haram and Cameroon military forces clash in Amchoukouli area of Fotokol after Boko Haram attempt to steal cattle.

assoc_actor_2: MRC: Movement for Renewal of Cameroon
notes: Week of 06 March. Police forces make several arrests of key opposition MRC members including lawyer Michele Ndoki. This is part of ongoing arrests and detention of MRC members.
05 March. Ambazonian separatists ambushed civilians during a funeral ceremony from Nkambe to Ndu in Donga-Mantung. No casualties are reported but vehicles were stolen.
05 March. Ambazonian separatists kidnap 3 students from Bamenda University in Bamenda of Mezam, releasing them 2 days later.
05 March. Boko Haram steal goods and vehicles, as well as kidnap 3 people, in Limani and Goglem of Mayo Sava.

assoc_actor_1: SYNAPAUC: National Union of Support Staff of State Universities of Cameroon; Labour Group (Cameroon)
notes: 05 March. As part of a nationwide strike, SYNAPAUC union protests at University of Douala of Wouri, demanding better working conditions and higher salaries. [size=dozens]

05 March. An unidentified armed group attacks the Cameroon College of Arts and Sciences in Kumba of Ekondo Titi. Staff and students are required to leave the campus but no reports of civilian casualties.
04 March. Suspected Ambazonian separatists kidnaps the Northwest regional chief of Environment and Nature Protection and his wife in Bamenda of Mezam, among 6 other ministers abducted in the region.
04 March. Cameroon military forces and Ambazonian separatists clash at Mile 20 neighborhood in Tombel of Kupe-Manenguba. During the fighting, 9 bars and shops were burned.
03 March. A government official, Franckline Che, is kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Buea of Fako.

Weekend of 02-03 March. Gunmen in military uniform, likely Cameroon military forces, burn homes and shops in Bamumkubit village of Balikumbat. Reports include 5 civilian injuries, looting of goods from the village and forcing "hundreds" of villagers to flee.
27 February. Boko Haram steal motorcycles, clothing and food in Bonderi of Kolofata.
25 February. Boko Haram steal over 700 cattle near Mafoulso in Logone Et Chari. No civilian deaths reported.
23 February. Ambazonian separatists attack the town of Ndu in Donga-Mantung, setting CPDM members' homes on fire and killing 2 civilians
22 February. Cameroon military forces shoot a civilian dead in Ngendzen village of Mbiam, in Bui.
22 February. An explosive detonates in Kerawa of Kolofata, killing one person and wounding 5.
21 February. A military escort of vehicles is attacked by Ambazonian separatists, leading to a battle between the two forces. No deaths are reported.
21 February. Boko Haram and Cameroon military forces clash on RN1 between Gasama and Goulma, killing 2 Boko Haram militants.
21 February. Two vehicles driving on the outskirts of Buea in Dibanda are intercepted by Ambazonian separatists and burned. No deaths were reported.
21 February. A journalist, Ambe Macmillan, is kidnapped by Ambazonian Separatists in Bamenda of Mezem.
20 February. Boko Haram kidnap a civilian in Hile Alifa of Logone et Chari in the Far North.
20 February. Cameroon military forces continue burning civilian homes in Kumbo. Government reports say this is to expose Ambazonian separatists.
19 February. Unidentified armed group attack a plantation in Tiko city of Fako division, cutting off fingers and ears of plantation workers.
19 February. Boko Haram attack Ouro Kessoum village near Amchide, killing 1 villager and wounding 2 others.

17-18 February. Cameroon military forces shot at civilians and burned the Shisong hospital and residential houses in Mbuluf, Ndu, and Takijah areas of Kumbo in Bui division. Three deaths are reported and the Cameroon government denies its involvement. Fatalities spread across two events.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Cameroon (1982-); CPDM: Cameroon Peoples Democratic Movement
notes: 18 February. Ambazonian separatists fire shots and set fire to the home of the Secretary General to the President, Paul Elung Che, in Bangem of Kupe-Manenguba division.
17 February. Unidentified armed group, likely Ambazonian separatists, clash with gendarmerie in Moundek of Moungo. 2 Civilians are killed during the fighting.
17 February. Ambazonian separatists clash with army forces in Buea of Fako division, killing an army captain.

17-18 February. Cameroon military forces shot at civilians and burned the Shisong hospital and residential houses in Mbuluf, Ndu, and Takijah areas of Kumbo in Bui division. Three deaths are reported and the Cameroon government denies its involvement. Fatalities spread across two events.
16 February. Ambazonian separatists and Cameroon military forces clash in Kumba of Ekondo Titi. A military vehicle was destroyed.

16 February. Unidentified armed group kidnap over 100 students and some teachers from St. Augustine College in Kumbo of Jakiri, releasing them a day later following negotiations to shut down the school.
15 February. Protesters of the AFCON construction sites protest in Garoua of Bardanke over unpaid wages.
Night of 14-15 February. Ambazonian separatists stab a policeman to death in Kumba of Ekondo Titi.
13 February. Motorcycle taxi drivers riot and clash with police in Yaounde after an altercation between police officers and a moto taxi driver.
13 February. Over 100 members of Boko Haram enter Ashigashiya of Kolofata and set fire to around 70 houses.

source: Guardian; Journal du Cameroun; Mimi Mefo
notes: 12 February. The Southwest governor of Cameroon, Bernard Okalia Bilai, and members of the government convoy was fired upon by Ambazonian separatists in Muyuka and again while on the way to Mbalangui of Meme. 12 reported as wounded and "several" separatists reported killed in ensuing clashes with military, coded as 10.
12 February. Gunshots reported in Mile 4 of Nkwen in Bamenda of the Northwest region, as part of ongoing violence between Ambazonian separatists and Cameroon military forces.
12 February. Boko Haram attack the village of Maloumri in Kolofata, killing one villager.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 11 February. Cameroon military BIR arrest around 200 international mercenaries from Burkina Faso, Nigeria, Mali and other countries at sea off the coast of Idenao.
10 February. Military forces and Ambazonian separatists clash in Bambili, Tubah. Several civilians fled due to the fighting.
Night of 10-11 February. A hospital in Kumba of Ekondo Titi is burned by Ambazonian separatists, killing 4 civilians and leaving several people burned.
09 February (night of). Two Boko Haram suicide bombers are shot and killed by the Cameroon army forces in Kolofata of Mayo-Sava.
